DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective study determine optimum daily dose BI 1744 CL tiotropium free dose combination ( deliver Respimat inhaler ) four week treatment patient COPD .
DOC.brief_title: Determining Optimal Free Dose Combination Tiotropium Bromide BI 1744 CL Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease ( COPD )
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion : 1 . All patient must sign informed consent 2 . All patient must diagnosis chronic obstructive pulmonary disease ( COPD ) must meet follow spirometric criterion : postbronchodilator force expiratory flow 1 second ( FEV1 ) = < 30 % predict normal < 80 % predict normal post bronchodilator FEV1 / force vital capacity ( FVC ) < 70 % Visit 1 4 . Male female patient , 40 year age old . 5 . Patients must current exsmokers smoke history 10 pack year Exclusion criterion : Patients significant disease COPD ; Patients clinically relevant abnormal baseline haematology , blood chemistry , urinalysis ; Patients history asthma total blood eosinophil count > =600/mm3 . Patients follow condition : diagnosis thyrotoxicosis ( due know class side effect profile ÃŸ2agonists ) diagnosis paroxysmal tachycardia Patients follow condition : history myocardial infarction within 1 year screen visit diagnosis clinically relevant cardiac arrhythmia malignancy patient undergone resection , radiation therapy chemotherapy within last five year Patients undergone thoracotomy pulmonary resection Patients treat follow concomitant medication : medication prolong QT/QTc interval oral Betaadrenergics oral corticosteroid medication unstable dos ( i.e. , less six week stable dose ) dose excess equivalent 10 mg prednisone per day 20 mg every day Pregnant nursing woman
